Package org.usfirst.frc.team4999.lights.compositor

Class AnimationCompositor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team4999.lights.compositor.AnimationCompositor
  • public class AnimationCompositor
extends java.lang.Object
    Composes component Views into one Animation, and sends the composed Animation to the Animator.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  AnimationCompositor.View
      A view represents a layer in the animation compositor stack.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AnimationCompositor()
      Instantiate an AnimationCompositor without an associated Animator.
      AnimationCompositor​(Animator animator)
      Instantiate an AnimationCompositor with an associated Animator.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnimationCompositor

        public AnimationCompositor​(Animator animator)
        Instantiate an AnimationCompositor with an associated Animator. The AnimationCompositor will automatically propagate changes to the LEDs via the associated Animator.

      • AnimationCompositor

        public AnimationCompositor()
        Instantiate an AnimationCompositor without an associated Animator.
        NOTE: AnimationCompositors not associated with an animator will not automatically propagate changes to the LEDs. The caller is expected to use getCurrentAnimation() whenever an animation changes.

    • Method Detail

      • getOpaqueView

        public AnimationCompositor.View getOpaqueView​(Animation animation)
        Get an opaque view for an animation at a default z-index.
        NOTE: the default z-index is an incrementing integer starting at 1. Be sure not to create conflicts with manually defined z-indices.
        Refer to getView(Animation, int, boolean) for more details.
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation to show
        Returns:
        The view

      • getTransparentView

        public AnimationCompositor.View getTransparentView​(Animation animation)
        Get a transparent view for an animation at a default z-index.
        NOTE: the default z-index is an incrementing integer starting at 1. Be sure not to create conflicts with manually defined z-indices.
        Refer to getView(Animation, int, boolean) for more details.
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation to show
        Returns:
        The view

      • getOpaqueView

        public AnimationCompositor.View getOpaqueView​(Animation animation,
                                              int zIndex)
        Get an opaque view for an animation at a specified z-index.
        Refer to getView(Animation, int, boolean) for more details.
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation to show
        zIndex - The z-index
        Returns:
        The view

      • getTransparentView

        public AnimationCompositor.View getTransparentView​(Animation animation,
                                                   int zIndex)
        Get a transparent view for an animation at a specified z-index.
        Refer to getView(Animation, int, boolean) for more details.
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation to show
        zIndex - The z-index
        Returns:
        The view

      • getView

        public AnimationCompositor.View getView​(Animation animation,
                                        int zIndex,
                                        boolean isTransparent)
        Get a view associated with this compositor at the specified z-index.
        NOTE: Views are unique per z-index. If conflicting z-indices are detected, the more recent view will be kept and the older view will be discarded.
        Refer to AnimationCompositor.View for more details about views.
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation to display in the view
        zIndex - The z-index priority of the view in the animation stack
        isTransparent - Whether the animation is expected to fill all pixels
        Returns:
        The view holding the specified animation at the specified z-index
        See Also:
        AnimationCompositor.View

      • getCurrentAnimation

        public Animation getCurrentAnimation()
        Get an Animation showing the composited Views. The resulting Animation is ready to be passed to the AsyncAnimator
        Returns:
        The composited Animation
